alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 04 at 3:28PM CDT until October 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. Many roads are still impassable or washed out. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Little River and Miller. Portions of northeast Texas, including the following county, Bowie. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Ashdown, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Red Lick, Ogden, Richmond, Mandeville, Leary, Pine Prairie, Red Bank, Arden and Wallace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
